circumstances: The twin engine airplane was engaged in a local post maintenance test flight at Miami and was carrying one engineer and one pilot. While flying at low height, both engines lost power. The pilot attempted an emergency belly landing in an field. While both occupants escaped uninjured, the aircraft was damaged beyond repair.
probable_cause:
Wheels-up landing due to inadequate preflight preparation. The following contributing factors were reported: 
- Mismanagement of fuel, 
- Miscalculated fuel consumption, 
- Fuel exhaustion,
- Inadequate maintenance and inspection, 
- 100 hours inspection in progress, 
- Fuel quantity indicating system not calibrated.
